storyInfo: The ancient twin moons reveal their real faces. Tonight, humanity gets a brief peek at the truth for the very first time.

attributes.content: The stars crash to the ground.
Someone lifts a head from the pristine white debris scattered all over the floor.
What's the matter, Control? You were faster before.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Since you weren't able to kill me, I'll launch my counteroffensive.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Don't blink.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: The stars struck down by Saria refloat, setting off on a new trajectory.
Kristen's fingers flick to the side.
Saria's legs suddenly feel a thousand times heavier.
The gravity... shifted?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: You used this trick to send Muelsyse away.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: But it won't work on me.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Enamel grows beneath Saria's feet like a pair of heavy duty boots, holding her in place.
And then, she begins to move forward, step by step.
Instead of refining the way you generate calcium particles, you've simply increased the release speed.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: The enamel you're generating has gotten even more brittle.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: A hardy resistance... isn't enough to cross the finish line.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: A metal planet shatters the enamel barrier, hitting Saria on her shoulder.
Saria does not cease her advance.
It happens twice, and then thrice.
Saria continues to speed up.
Saria, stop.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: 'Stop'?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: That's what I said to you.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: I can tell you all about my plans...
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Then why do you insist on stopping me? There will be no other victims in this plan. I just...
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Just... wanted to set off some harmless fireworks over the skies of Trimounts.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: The moment H.A.M.H.R.R. finishes its job, both the military and Maylander will breathe a sigh of relief.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: The residents of Trimounts will be momentarily captivated by the spectacle unfolding before them in the sky, but soon enough their focus will be directed towards other, more deserving concerns.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Rhine Lab... might be the most affected party here. She will lose her Control, possibly several Directors, and the confidence of powerful Columbian organizations.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Then you should have stayed on the ground.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Clean up the mess, protect those who might be hurt by this, and carry our Rhine Lab through the crisis. You've always been good at that.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: You forgot again, I resigned... a long time ago.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: People like Blake like to call scientists 'mad.'
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: And we couldn't care any less.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: But science is supposed to be rational.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Kristen, when I first heard the story of your parents, I thought... they shouldn't have seen an ending like that.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: If they hadn't perished in that accident, and had returned before hitting the barrier...
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: They would have brought back incomparably precious data, as well as the possibility of a second attempt.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: You obviously...
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: ...I admire their will and determination.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: But I've never been one to approve of sacrifice, even justified and inevitable.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Ferdinand, Nasti, Parvis... they and many others always thought me too conservative.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: They see me as a stickler for rules, obstructing all of you.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Hah... 'Can a woman like this even be called a scientist?'
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Even I myself... have asked this question.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: You're the most dedicated truth seeker I know.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: ...The truth.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Truth is the inertia that comes after order. I believe science can bring us truth, and truth can restrain madness, bringing about a better society for everyone.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Us Vouivres have always been accompanied by an instinctive madness, for as long as we can remember. Violence, savagery... we took an extremely long time just to step out of that chaotic darkness.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: That's what I have been taught ever since I was small. I use reason to control myself, and desperately... want to confront the madness I see in all of you.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: But you can't do it.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Saria, if you intend to hold onto Rhine Lab by your lonesome, you are sure to be disappointed.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Because humanity's thirst for progress is inherently undefeatable.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: A type of desire, a type of 'madness,' but also a natural instinct, and the fuel that has brought us from the desolate barrenlands to where we stand.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Which is why I've come here, and not for a fight.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: The heavy stars fall on her like a rockslide, and gravity controls the airflow to howl at her entire body.
Calcium crystals crumble from head to toe, but the mountaineer is determined to greet the storm with her own form.
Kristen, I almost admitted my own defeat while searching for you.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Until someone said to me, that I should return to the origin. So on my way here, I've been looking back... at where we all started.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Yes, I dread losing control, but it's not a fear of chaos, but a fear of regression caused by it.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: So I must progress onward, as humanity must. Because for us, the trek is far from over.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Indeed, to this day, humanity still lives in the dark.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: After all... we can't even see through the sky hanging over our heads.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: The road is long—very, very long.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: We hold more knowledge than the average bystander, so we must shoulder heavier responsibilities. We should ahead of them, eliminate any dangers, and carefully lead them on the path forward.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: A real pioneer should be clearing the way for all humanity, instead of jumping headfirst into the abyss, never to return.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: That is my foundation, and I will stand by it.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Caught you.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: She has weathered the storm. She crosses the galaxy.
The final calcium crystals spread from one palm to the back of another, and the metal exoskeleton begins to tremble.
The synthetic stars ceaselessly revolve around the two in unison.
Everything else around them has sunk into chaos as a result of their Arts colliding and destroying each other.
Only the protector's will remains unshaken as the earth.
You're always slightly late.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And you're always slightly early. Been waiting long, Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Not really.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I thought you would be next. You are like a microcosm of everything that happened in Ursus.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm sorry, I really am.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Sorry...? For what?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: You knew my husband and I were already doomed when we made our decision at the research institute. You're not the type to get depressed...
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: ...No, perhaps you might have even become more depressed in the last century.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I hold regrets, and maybe even remorse towards your story, but not much sorrow.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm talking about your daughter. Folinic doesn't live in the better era that you wished for, an era where hate and violence have been forgotten. The same goes for Lyudmila.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Like I said, you're like a microcosm, Lillia.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You and Folinic have an unbreakable bond formed of hatred and blood. A microcosm. I've seen it many a time, a futile destruction.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Sounds like you're tired.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: You weren't created to be a savior. You can't level a mountain with a finger, or destroy a city with your eyes.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Haha... just what kind of plebeian would hope that you were invincible? Do those fools think they could uphold a civilization teetering on the edge of collapse with just violence?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: There might be some with such a hope.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: They hope that I can bring them a future. Hope to survive in my country. Hope for a victory under my command.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You've failed them. Because you're just Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Our conversation has yielded no answers.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes. You've admitted it, you're tired.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: But why? You're always on the path of avoiding their self-destruction... but the power you hold is just that miniscule.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: There's no way you can teleport from Victoria to Ursus, or monitor every Sarkaz on Terra to see what dangerous witchcraft they're delving into this time.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Whatever you do just grows more and more futile, so you're starting to get impatient, right?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: And especially with—
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I know...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hehe... you already know what you're afraid of, yet you're still able to keep yourself from thinking about it.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Not letting Theresa and Theresis appear in front of you, even your subconsciousness is practically begging for it.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: The same goes for your own determination, Kal'tsit, you think people will treat you gently, and so that pair of siblings won't talk to you like this.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: How strange. You were so cold before that I never imagined you would seek the warmth of others. From such a perspective, you really have become weak.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Spring is chilly here, I'll catch a cold soon if I stay out any longer. We should go somewhere with a warmer spring.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Shall we go inside?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: ...Sure.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Snow...?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hm...? A rare outsider. Are you heading for the sacred mountain?
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Pilgrims as young as you rarely make it up here, but why aren't you continuing your ascent? Legs got frostbite?
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Sacred mountain... are we in Kjerag?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kjerag? Where is that?
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Is that where you're from?
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: I wouldn't consider it as such.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's one of the most spectacular mountains on Terra. I once saw a group of destitute refugees settle and rebuild their lives in that paradise free of Catastrophe.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Oh, it must be a beautiful place then.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Terra... it sounds so small. That's where you're from?
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...I come from Terra...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And you?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Toward the mountain. We're born with this one goal.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Born with it?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We frolic among the trees on the mossy plains in our youth, and learn from the rocks, and in our prime, we began climbing the mountain.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: We did so much groundwork at the foot of the mountain, weaving strands of dawnlight into ropes, or preparing a pair of shoes that won't be contaminated by the darkness of the night.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: And then, we begin climbing the mountain.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: The road is long and full of obstacles, and we only harvest resources from the valleys. Fortunately for us, the sacred mountain is merciful, and feed us with death, so we dedicate our long lives to this mountain path in return.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: It must be an exhausting journey, coming all the way here.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Exhausting? No, no, no.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: The snow does not mourn its melting. This is all from the self-flattering efforts of others, while we are just climbers.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: What is this sacred mountain called? And what should I call you?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This mountain is called 'time,' and us? We are just insignificant lives.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Time is such a grand thing, isn't it? You should be well aware of this.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Will the mountain change? Has anyone reached the summit?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I don't know. What I mean by that is—maybe.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Try shouting at the abyss of time. The response you'll receive is a gift from the sacred mountain.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Time will not give you an automatic answer, but it will respond. Our predecessors called this response 'fate.'
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: And fate is the echoes of the cries of life.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Have you never done this before?
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Well... it seems like there will be a blizzard tonight.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: I should go prepare dinner, and find a place to set up camp... do you need a place to rest? We can go together, girl.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Sure... old man.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'd like to know, what's there to fill your stomach?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Perhaps we'll be having 'despair,' child.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Maybe you can finish your prayers before dinner. Do your shouting before the blizzard blots everything from sight.
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: Louder!
attributes.name: Elderly Pilgrim

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You will become yourself.
attributes.name: Giant Skeleton

attributes.content: Kal'tsit. Your judgment is rational. For this I feel sorry.
attributes.name: Giant Skeleton

attributes.content: Sorry for what?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It's only myself...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Because I am your time.
attributes.name: Giant Skeleton

attributes.content: I single-handedly caused your distrust towards humanity, your pessimism, your dismay, and your impatience with no way out.
attributes.name: Giant Skeleton

attributes.content: However... however, from her and on her, you saw a possibility.
attributes.name: Giant Skeleton

attributes.content: Out of your tendency to be overly cautious and anxious, you suspect that this feeling is merely a misjudgment caused by your irritation... after all, the world is breaking out of your knowledge and control. And the new you was only born not long ago.
attributes.name: Giant Skeleton

attributes.content: And yet you've considered it many times before, how much easier it would be, if you chose to trust them instead.
attributes.name: Giant Skeleton

attributes.content: ——I am your time. Kal'tsit, you omniscient fool——
attributes.name: Giant Skeleton

attributes.content: You forget the little details, you are not a chosen savior. You should not be. You're not always right either.
attributes.name: Giant Skeleton

attributes.content: Even if you've already made up your mind.
attributes.name: 'Life'

attributes.content: You know better than anyone else how limited time is. And there isn't much left.
attributes.name: 'Life'

attributes.content: You should try giving up. And choose to trust someone you can believe in.
attributes.name: 'Life'

attributes.content: You are not trusted because you are 'Kal'tsit,' nor do you become 'Kal'tsit' because you are trusted.
attributes.name: 'Life'

attributes.content: You are the echoes of a valley, water dripping off a cliff. Your responsibilities weigh beyond what your abilities can bear, and now at least, there are people to share these responsibilities with.
attributes.name: 'Life'

attributes.content: What you have lost and gained in this short period of the past few centuries far exceeds your former days, so long they were that you could only use for progress and evolution.
attributes.name: 'Life'

attributes.content: Everything is about to end, Kal'tsit, and you know this. Will you stay your passivity, your pessimism, your apathy?
attributes.name: 'Life'

attributes.content: Don't forget your original question. Don't forget the answer that you nearly had.
attributes.name: 'Life'

attributes.content: Go on. AMa-10. The meaning of your existence is more than you yourself.
attributes.name: 'Life'

attributes.content: ...Let's stop here.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Indeed.
attributes.name: Voice of the 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Indeed... this is enough.
attributes.name: Voice of the 'Preserver'

attributes.content: And the Doctor?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Calming down elsewhere. I do intend to spend some time with you alone.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: I have a question for you, AMa-10, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: For the past ten thousand years... have you really lived on this land?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It seems you've changed quite a lot. We haven't interacted much, but you shouldn't be your current self.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: What did you choose?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: I've seen wars lasting several millennia, the rise and co-existing of nations, and people growing from their misunderstandings and conflicts.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But in the end, they all scattered to the wind just like the sands of Sargon. But in the blink of an eye, history has already given birth to new children.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I've seen the cycle repeat too many times. The cycle itself looms large and weighs heavy, and I'm fully aware that time is running out.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And then, I ran into a unique opportunity.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I once met two Teekaz, who were closer than any creature in any era, to the truth of continuing civilization.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But now, you are all as fragile as the trash on an asteroid belt, so how can you possibly talk of continuing—
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: ——Wait. You are saying...
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: The black crown still remains on Terra?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: 'The Lord of Fiends.' As the ancient Teekaz called it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Teekaz...? Those odd endemic lifeforms?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: What a fluke, I had thought it would have been left behind on...
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: ...The black crown. I dislike the shape it takes on the physical plane, a crown? Leaves a bad taste.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: A crown points to royalty. This ancient imagery implies power.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: In this downward trend of collapse, where the misunderstandings over ideology and race push surface civilization toward self-destruction, within an extravagant mirage of peace and unity—
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: The most direct method should be to use those powers to reshape the will of all living beings, and fuse them into a singular form.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: What can a false leader made of memories, emotions and knowledge even achieve?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.options: Don't underestimate Amiya.;Don't underestimate Rhodes Island.;Don't underestimate us.

attributes.content: Doctor, are you alright?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.options: Just needed a breather...;......;This thing has gone too far...

attributes.content: Perhaps I have underestimated you, but that does not affect the ending already set in stone.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: You want me to believe that such a tiny piece of heritage is enough to change fate?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: 'Heritage' is humanity's sole achievement ever since our ancient ancestors learned to use tools and fire.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Knowledge, culture, history. So-called civilization is nothing more than that.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: There will be a day when the black crown will no longer belong to Amiya alone. And we will have to fight to survive, no matter who the enemy is.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You've chosen to fight for Terra.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: This is what you're decided? With this body, this identity? You are different from Kristen and her kind.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Your struggles... are far from your original intent.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Even Rhodes Island's reserve op teams know the difference between fighting for themselves and fighting for others.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And we've all done our preparations, this great land of Terra is where I grew up.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I'm an employee of Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A part of the ship sailing on the land called Terra.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: ...'Infected' is just, too trivial a proposition... however... infected... Originium, huh...
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Then, what about you?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: 'Doctor'.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.options: ...I'm an employee of Rhodes Island.;I'm an employee of Rhodes Island.;I'm an employee of Rhodes Island...

attributes.content: I also have a question for you, Trevor Friston.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How has your time been, in this... equally long period of time?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The 'Perturbation' system has been lifted.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Kristen, tell me how to stop the energy accumulation. And where exactly does the energy come from?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: This will be an extremely long story.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: I will try to crack the Galleria's control panel before I'm done listening.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Saria, you know, the history of this land is far longer than most realize.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: I believe every generation produces its own skeptics, just like my parents and I. Have our ventures really been completely fruitless?
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: And... was there perhaps a more ancient point in time that the sky hanging over us, was not as we see it today?
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: I remember. That was one of the establishing goals of Rhine Lab's Scientific Investigation Section.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Conventional exploration alone has already provided me with plenty of interesting information.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: After you left Rhine, I picked up some interests I had previously, and tried leaving the laboratory, heading to various corners of the world that mankind had scarcely set foot on.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: The purpose of these journeys was not to observe the sky.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: The stars are not worth looking at——I came to this conclusion early on, after countless calculations.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: I only... wanted to try and find more collaborators.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Since the last Leithanian Arts Detector Orb fell short at 500 meters below the barrier, the academic circles in most countries abandoned their research into the thing.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: So what I've been looking for... a voice that doesn't belong to this era.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Like the immortals who rely on Originium Arts to escape the shackles of life, or the Feranmuts older than any country?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Perhaps even older than those regarded as gods, a being so old that history has forgotten them.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Before I set off on my journey, I had no idea what I was going to find. I just... felt a calling. Across time and space, directing me toward that door.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: And what... was inside the door?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Everything.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: I found the answers to all my questions. How we managed to trek across history to make it here, about the land's unexplored secrets, and about the myriad of possibilities for our future.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: But at the same time...
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: I also saw the end of a civilization, and a spirit abandoned by time.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: ...Time. Time is nothing but a vile joke.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: At the end of the world, when the seas dried up and the rocks rotted away as everything changed, I hid in this grim bunker, repeating a futile act—
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: —Shouting into the void.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: My words permeated every moon and space itself, every tunnel and corner of the stars.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: The universe did not respond to me. I prayed to the pitch-black despair for tens of thousands of years, and the only thing I heard in return, was the reverberations of destruction...
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Whenever I longed for a survivor's response, the sound of collapse and rays of occupied light still lingering among the stars would emerge...
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: It was a black hole of futile effort. My emotions were far beyond what any regular lifeform would ever experience or empathize with.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: In the endless silence, all I could hear was the heartbeats of my people growing ever weaker, but their dormant hearts should not have been beating at all.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Nightmares cannot jolt me awake, because it is impossible for me to sleep.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: I hate myself for having these emotions. I wish I could operate like a pure machine. I hate the other me that assigned me a fate like this.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: I knew very well the plan had already concluded. The energy in these... 'sarcophagi' was not enough to power the next stage of recovery in our plans.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Soon after, I was swept into the nothingness. Endless, and numb...
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: So the contact with Kristen offered you a gamble.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Since your people could never wake up, you might as well...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The first time I saw that humanoid creature, what I felt was... surprise.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: I've been watching the depths of space far, far away, not what happened on the surface. I noticed the growth of life, but never expected it to knock on my door.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: We spent a long time talking. Though in reality, it was no longer than a few months.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Kristen fired question after question, as if she was meeting a manifestation of truth.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: And remarkably, every topic would send her into a long period of reflection and silence, instead of satisfying her thirst for knowledge.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: She catalyzed an idea, but she didn't voice it herself—Kristen refused to be the one to execute the plan.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.options: Plan?;......;Wasn't she just using Rhine Lab to achieve her goals?

attributes.content: She believes that someday, this land will need a group that can separate themselves from politics and unite as a people. This farsighted group would have to employ everything at their disposal...
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: ...To build an ark.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: The pioneers would inevitably face the struggle of understanding, and would face division and suffering.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: But reality is not myth, as Babel has proven.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So what is Rhodes Island to you, if you hold no hope for all of this?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: You're right about that.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We can discuss this so-called 'hope.'
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kristen's little helpers have already begun fiddling with the 'sarcophagi's' technology. I have no qualms with it, but this must mean something important for Terra.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Use it well. Kristen's political views are not without a few flaws.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Loken's research has effectively been put under control. I cannot possibly trust Columbia as a nation, but there is someone behind the Maylander Foundation that is worth negotiating with.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: That is good. And then, tell me, are the deep sea-dwelling Ægir really so different from the civilizations on land?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: What I can tell you far surpasses whatever Kristen has told you.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Indeed. I cannot comprehend why these creatures with bodily structures inadequately suited to survive in the deep sea would establish a civilization in the ocean.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: But this suggests they depend on some product of the seafloor. The form of their civilization has been distorted by external forces, making them stronger, but also causing problems.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Ægir is a settlement that must be united. Regardless of the problems caused by those rampant—'sea monsters'? I believe that's what they are called—Terra cannot leave such a developed nation alone.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Considering their approximate geographical location, and if they use what they might have in abundance appropriately, my guess is that what Kristen is doing right now is not necessarily out of the Ægir's reach.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: With strength comes arrogance. Ægir is not so easy to persuade.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Though fortunately, due to a series of incidents, I have had the good fortune to establish a precious friendship with some Ægir.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This will be an impactful breakthrough. Since the Profound Silence, Ægir can no longer remain silent.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Excellent.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: The march of the Nightzmora basically only exists as a legend in the databases of Columbia, with no decent historical texts to refer to.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: But if the legendary event was not, in fact, a falsehood... then he is indeed an incredible hero.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Even if we take Originium as the power source, the fact that such a tyrant born on Terra thousands of years ago could achieve such a great feat in a much more primitive environment does inspire wonder.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: However—the south is already in ruins, so you should look north.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Have you been there?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: No. Even further north... at the ends of the endless icefields.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I tried many times, but I've yet to find anything with the limits of my own abilities.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But you know what's over there.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: ...I do.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So, don't ignore the door that lies there. Push it open when you need to, and it will show you a boundless vista.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Just pushing that door is already far beyond what most are capable of.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And so it is up to all of you to find a way.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: The land is vast, and civilization continues to advance, so surely there is more than one Kristen?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: You seem to trust the denizens of this land more than I previously thought.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Trust? I hand the tinder to you. I have given up everything on my end.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Whether or not... you can succeed, nothing can be changed... this is my failure. Trust?
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: I... yes... I do not know.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Perhaps I just want to see any lifeform able to converse and interact with one another, to continue existing.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: You know this—compared with the problems on the distant horizon, there is something that could happen at any moment. War.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Even if I look only through the eyes of Columbia, I sense the imminent danger to your world, and the fire that can ignite at any time.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: You will require preparation. Do what you must. To extinguish the flame, or to let it produce new life, this is your choice to make.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Those who are truly able to save the denizens of Terra, are always and only themselves.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: This need for awakening has not changed since time immemorial, because it is all part of what 'humanity' is.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.options: Thank you.;......;We will discover the truth.

attributes.content: The sky is about to be opened. But the barrier will soon heal itself. Perhaps it will take a few days, or months, or years.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: But the people of Terra will take that limited, veracious scene into their eyes, and will keep the moonlight and the distant planets in their memories.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: I hope... Kristen hopes, that this will be a powerful signal.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: A signal to herald the next great age.
attributes.name: 'Preserver'

attributes.content: Saria, would you like to gaze at the stars together? Just like we did before?
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: We can talk about this after we descend.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: ...The starry sky.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Or more precisely, what we gaze at is a barrier. The 'starpod.'
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: There's still a thousand meters to go... our current position is already near the limit of humanity's touch.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: The ionization response is too strong. At this height, the instruments can't operate with all the interference.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: The control panel is completely useless... I should have known. You have no intention of letting the Galleria Stellaria last much longer.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Yes, it just has to last until I break the barrier.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: The barrier... though we have always been inclined towards the usage of 'barrier,' you're well aware that the shape of it is more than just a 'barrier' as per conjecture.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: It might not even be a 'barrier' at all, but an extremely wide space.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: It might even lack endpoints. This six thousand meters—what we understand as 'normal airspace' is actually 'abnormal.'
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: And in that case, 'breaking' it was never an option.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: It can indeed be broken.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: You've never once doubted it.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: 6972 Meters. If you fly straight up at this angle, as long as you can soar past that height, the Galleria Stellaria will no longer be disturbed by any ionization reactions.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Fine, so you have credible data from that spirit. But this doesn't reduce the danger of exploring the skies at all.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: No, even if... if we assume the barrier is enveloping the land like a membrane as you say, it means we know less than nothing about the space beyond it.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: This makes your actions even more hazardous. You could even bring disaster upon this land.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: The people are simply inadequately prepared for this.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: There will never be 'adequate' preparation. If there is indeed a calamity looming over us, then humanity is already living under a ticking clock.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: If that's the case, then we should be even more...
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: ...Even more cautious, right?
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Saria, I believe... there will come a day when a much more complete exploration team will be formed, and with more data and full support, they will enter into the depths of space before our very eyes.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: This is also the future I hope for.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: But you yourself are not in this future of yours.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: True.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: I'm ill-suited to be called a pioneer. On that point, I fully agree with your view.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: If possible... I would prefer to become a starting point.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Just like once, back when... I watched the light of those flames burning in the sky...
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: That was last thing my parents left me——
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: ——A starting point.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Where's the closest escape pod?
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: None left. Those with the capability to execute the return module are already gone.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Then hold onto me. I will wrap the both of us in calcification. We might not even have a chance of survival, but we can try.
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: Saria, lower your gaze.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: What—
attributes.name: Saria

attributes.content: You're the one who didn't look down this time.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: The gravity abruptly shifts without warning, and Saria feels only space beneath her feet.
She did not expect Kristen to set up an emergency escape door at the Galleria Stellaria's center.
No, Saria thinks to herself, she should have expected it long before. This door is not for the owner of the planetarium. Kristen knew that at the very last moment, Saria would come.
The sudden change of mass robs Saria of her voice, and she fails to yell out anything at all. She also knows that there is nothing she can grab, but still stretches her hand out.
Starlight and earth pour into her view, while Kristen only gets further and further away.
Saria... you always wanted me to take a good look at the world.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Now I have.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: It is... equally beautiful.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: You will watch it and the people it nurtures in my stead. This I always knew.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Just as you have in the past, and will in the future.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: And I... I'm not the type to lead people on, step by step.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: I am just a pair of eyes.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Eyes that... will peer into the unfamiliar depths of space for all that live on that land.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: ...Friston.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: I can almost see the true starry sky... it probably hasn't changed much from what you've told me.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: In over ten thousand years...
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: Me and you, our civilization and yours...
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: On the scale of the universe, we really are insignificantly small.
attributes.name: Kristen

attributes.content: A torrent of energy pounds the accumulating area of this giant airborne construct, and the ring hovering up high looks almost swallowed by the tremendous amount of energy.
Immediately afterwards, an even greater amount concentrates at its core.
Enough to destroy any massive nomadic city.
And this world is just so puny and shallow, how could it ever bear it?
The light converges and abandons the earth, stabbing upwards into the air.
Under the unprecedented energy surge, wave after wave of dazzling ripples emerge on the pitch-black curtain devoid of any life.
The false sky is at last rent asunder.
The ancient twin moons expose their real faces.
Tonight, the truth will be perceived by humanity for the very first time.
